io.permazen.core.type

Class NonNullFieldType<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.permazen.core.FieldType<T>
      • io.permazen.core.type.NonNullFieldType<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparator<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArrayType, BigDecimalType, BigIntegerType, BitSetType, DateType, DurationType, EnumType, Inet4AddressType, Inet6AddressType, InetAddressType, InstantType, LocalDateTimeType, LocalDateType, LocalTimeType, MonthDayType, ObjIdType, OffsetDateTimeType, OffsetTimeType, PeriodType, PrimitiveType, StringConvertedType, StringType, TupleFieldType, UnsignedIntType, UUIDType, YearMonthType, YearType, ZonedDateTimeType, ZoneOffsetType

    public abstract class NonNullFieldType<T>
extends FieldType<T>
    Support superclass for FieldType's that don't support null values.

    Except for primitive types, such types may not be used standalone, but only within an outer type such as NullSafeType.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        public T validate(Object obj)
        Description copied from class: FieldType
        Verify the given object is a valid instance of this FieldType's Java type and cast it to that type.

        Note that this method must throw IllegalArgumentException, not ClassCastException or NullPointerException, if obj does not have the correct type, or is an illegal null value.

        This method is allowed to perform widening conversions of the object that lose no information, e.g., from Integer to Long.

        The implementation in FieldType simply casts the value using this instance's raw Java type. Subclasses should override this method to implement any other restrictions, e.g., disallowing null values.

        Overrides:
        validate in class FieldType<T>
        Parameters:
        obj - object to validate
        Returns:
        obj cast to this field's type
